Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/25/2017
I lived here for a year and had a great time. Barely had any issue except my A/C was broken one day in the middle of summer, but emergency maintenance was available and was able to fix in a day. Community is usually calm and clean. Very safe to walk around even in late nights. Affordable price, reasonably close to Duke. I highly recommend if anyone is willing to move in.

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/25/2017
I lived at Alden place for 7 months. Overall, I think this is a pretty good place to live. The community is diverse and overall pretty nice. there's a great mix of people in this complex and I really love that. 1. Management has been pretty good. My biggest complaint is that I had to wait to move in (2-3 hours), and then had to ask for the included microwave to be installed when they said they'd install it while I was waiting to move in. They were great about it and set me up the day I came in to remind them. Just wish I didn't have to remind is all. Second biggest complaint is that they do seem to fail to make changes as discussed with them. For example, I asked to extend my lease, but it wasn't changed despite an email confirmation that said they would. Again, was fixed, but frustrating to know that they aren't taking care of what they need to sometimes. A plus: They aren't pushy. They allow me to keep my solitude without flooding my inbox. 2. Maintenance guys are great, but had an incident where the guy caused a bigger leak from a toilet problem. That said, they came in to fix it, so all was well. 3. Their amenities are nice, but I saw a lack of care for some things. For example, the dog waste bag stations took FOREVER to be filled. It took literally 2 months at one point. They seem to be staying on top of it now though, which is great! I really do wish they'd take better care of the pools. A lot of dead bugs and leaves floating in there. Would also be awesome if maintenance could come through and wash the cobwebs off the stairs and outside corners. 4. Noise is ok. I lived on a 2nd floor and had no issues with my neighbors upstairs. My neighbor downstairs can hear my dog prance around though, so it's not the best place for a bigger dog unless you're on the first floor. Lots of neighbors enjoy their balconies and play music sometimes, but its never so loud that I've been bothered. 5. I felt very safe here. The only crime reported during my stay were a couple of break ins into cars that were already unlocked. The alarm system is extremely comforting! Overall, I'd definitely suggest this place to friends. I think it is a safe and wonderful place with a little bit of character.

Alden place is HORRIBLE. My roommates and I had issues with them from the time we moved in to the time we moved out. The staff is incredibly rude, unorganized and unfriendly. They tried to charge double rent for the first month because they didn't document that we already paid first months rent. They literally tried to charge us and short hand us with EVERYTHING. This is the 5th apartment complex I've lived in and I've never had issues like this before. They will do just about anything to ensure you pay for something that was their fault. If you want to be overcharged and end up paying a ridiculous amount of money outside of paying rent due to their mistakes, then live at Alden place. I took a picture of my keys, pool pass and mailbox key before I handed it to them because I was afraid they would contact me and try to charge me for not handing them in so I made sure I had proof. This place is awful!

Verified Manager10/04/2016

Thank you for sharing your experience, as with all comments, we value your opinion and will use yours as a training tool to continually strive to improve our customer service. We did have a move in this past Saturday, which we walked the apartment home with the resident the day prior. As of Friday, all light bulbs were functioning. It is unfortunate that 3 of the bulbs burned out that night, which we replaced on Monday. We do offer 24 hour maintenance assistance for emergencies if you ever have a need for that. If you would like to discuss this further or if you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to any of our office team members. We sincerely hope that we can meet or exceed your expectations throughout the remaining duration of your lease.

Report
Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/04/2016
Alden Place has wonderful, clean grounds, great apartment layouts, & warm, welcoming staff. Everyone has been caring and cooperative. However, when we moved in, we found a lot of maintenence issues with the apartment like broken blinds, numerous light fixtures not working, dripping sink, refrigerator needing to be replaced, etc. It seemed as if they didn't really check the apartment between residents. It was a bit stressful to deal with all of the issues whilst moving in. BUT, once I complained and expressed my unhappiness, every single issue was fixed within 24 hours and done so efficiently. The maintenence staff knows exactly what they are doing (I cannot fully express how well they do their job)-- so if you are planning to move in make sure you have them on speed dial. Overall, the apartment is beautiful and the area seems safe. The security alarms in each apartment and minimal pet rent ($10 a month for two pets) is great. I feel very at home. Definitely one of the better places to reside in Durham.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/13/2016
We've lived here for over a year. The apartments are nice and the grounds are kept beautifully. Unfortunately, the service from management/the leasing office is quite less than stellar in my experience. I've had poor interactions with the leasing office since I moved in, but decided to wait to write a review so I could have a whole year's worth of experience - I didn't want to write a poor review because of isolated incidents. After a year, however, it's been consistent: the service isn't great. Some in the front office are often rude and it seems management is often inconsiderate of the residents. Giving three stars overall, almost 4. I'd still recommend living here, as overall it's a good place, I think. I do not regret choosing this apartment to live in. If anything changes, I'll update this review. Some specific comments on star ratings for the specific categories: Noise: The apartments are right beside 15/501 and the road noise can sometimes be loud. I live on the very north end of the apartments, though, and I imagine it's much better to the south. I, unfortunately, have pretty noisy new neighbors above me, but the community is quiet overall. Grounds: Kept up very beautifully. Kudos to the landscapers. Safety: We get notified of break-ins a few times a year, encouraging us to lock our doors and set or alarms (each unit has an alarm). I do not feel unsafe, and setting the alarm and having renter's insurance seems a reasonable precaution. Neighborhood: The surrounding communities south of 15/501 are kind-of dingy - not pretty or kept up well. Otherwise I love the location. Target is close, shopping center near I-40, and easy access to I-40, Downtown Durham, and Chapel Hill. Maintenance: Maintenance had always been immediately responsive to work orders, and my interactions with maintenance staff have been positive. I have had one poor experience with a maintenance issue, but that poor experience was with management's handling, not maintenance directly. There are some minor maintenance issues with my apartment that I think have mostly to do with the age of the property; nothing serious, though. Staff (leasing office): In my experience, only Lourdes from the front office has been consistently courteous and helpful. She handled my lease when I first moved it and she knows my name when I go to the office. My experience with others at the leasing office have been hit-and-miss - probably 50-50. I don't really like going to the leasing office for this reason. I don't know that I've met everyone working at the leasing office now, so sorry to generalize. One more comment: Alden Place requires renter's insurance and "partners" with a particular insurance provider to provide insurance to their residents. By shopping around, I was able to purchase much cheaper insurance and with higher liability coverage than from their "preferred provider." I recommend shopping around; remember you'll usually get multi-policy discounts with your auto insurance provider.

Resident
2014 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/22/2016
Alden Place is the place to be. We've been here for just over 2 years. The location of the property is great. Plenty of local shops and pretty much anything you'd need is around you. The office staff is always great to deal with, no hassle, no run around, always friendly and personable. We've enjoyed our time here and will continue to do so. The maintenance staff is always quick to respond to any issue we've had and always take care of them. There are beautiful amenities that get put to use by us all the time. It's nice when you have company and plenty of things to do in your complex. I would recommend this beautiful place to anyone looking for a new home.

Resident
2015 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/22/2016
My roommate and I are relatively new to the area. When we came to look at apartments, Lourdes and LaShawn showed us around the property and really sold us; they are the main reason we selected this apartment over all the others. Since we moved in the office staff has turned over, and not for the better. We don't get the same "homey" feeling we did when we first moved in and dread having to go to the office for anything whether it is to put in a work order or simply retrieve a package. The new manager is unapproachable, not personable, and very unprofessional; the whole atmosphere is just tense. We also had an instance where the alarms were going off in our apartment for no reason at night. We called the maintenance line several times and the on-call either did not pick up or hung up on us. What would have happened if it was an emergency? What were we supposed to do? These are a couple reasons why I would not recommend these apartments to a future resident. Even though our lease will not be up for a couple months, we have already started looking for a new place to live. It is a shame to see such a good thing go bad.

2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/10/2015
Alden Place was a Godsend after a long month of apartment hunting, good and bad. We looked in Chapel Hill and Carrboro, but finally decided to settled in Durham due to the affordability and welcoming environment that Alden Place provided. After looking at over five complexes, our leasing manager at AP was extremely courteous and professional with our transactions. We felt very comfortable and she was very friendly and genuine with us. She processed our applications immediately and stayed late on a FRIDAY because she knew that we loved the place and needed a place to live. Super kudos to her and the rest of the staff, because they really make this place special. I now know all of the leasing manager by name. And it definitely says something about a place where the staff know the residents and their kids by name. They really take care in their work and truly want you to live headache-free. In terms of the apartment itself, we were surprised by how modern it looked. 9ft ceilings, screened-in porch, as well as a breakfast bar! Our pantry is huge and our walk-in closets are huge. In terms of the area, it is a few miles (or less) of all the necessities. (i.e. dry cleaning, groceries, Target, etc.). It is right off the 15/501 and close to I-40. There is also a city bus line that runs on the edge of the property that take you to places like Duke and UNC if needed. Ample parking and the club house is nice. Weight room is a bit small for the size of the complex. And my ONLY other criticism is that there isn't sidewalk on the whole property and leading out of the complex. There is also not a traffic / pedestrian light on the University Dr. side which is dangerous for walkers/runners.

As far as the apartment goes, I'm in a two bedroom and anytime a friend comes by they always comment on the size of the apartment and how bright it is inside. The windows are large and the open kitchen is really nice when I'm entertaining. It is also very conveniently located to several shopping centers, Duke and UNC campuses and even the airport is only a 15 minute drive away. I rarely see my neighbors, and they don't seem to be a 'neighborly' group, but I think the management company is trying to create ways to improve the community spirit for those that do want that experience. Overall, the people living here are an ecclectic group of mostly professionals or graduate level students, some with small children. It's quiet, well- maintained and safe.

Pros: -very affordable -not far from downtown Durham, Duke, or Chapel Hill (if you don't mind driving) -spacious units -I had brand new carpet in my unit when I moved in, which was awesome and totally unexpected. -relatively few bugs compared to other apartments in the area -amenities are really nice, though not always well attended to (e.g. great pool area, but management hasn't bothered to fix the grill starter which has been broken, according to them, for over a year) Cons: -Maintenance tends to be slow and unhelpful. They have fixed one small problem for me, but have repeatedly told me that my ancient dishwasher works fine (it doesn't). -If you live here, you have to drive everywhere (restaurants, work, bars, etc.) For runners, there aren't really any nice places to run in the area either. -Appliances aren't energy efficient so utilities may be a bit pricier than some newer apartments in the area. Also, there are only washers/dryers in some of the units (ask about your particular unit before signing the lease!) My take: When I was initially considering living at Alden Place, I was deterred by some of the older reviews on this website. DON'T BE! The current management group (Fogelman) has apparently really turned this complex around over the course of the last few years. For me, this is a great place to live.

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/30/2014
Overall decent place to live. I live on the third floor so I pay a bit more for this. The staff are nice and the maintenance fix our issues. I like the outdoor landscaping. I just think though this place might be more expensive compared to other complexes where you can get more. Some constructive criticism though: 1) Maintenance often arrive a lot later than what they stated. While I understand things might come up, either a more accurate estimate, a call informing us they're coming later, or some online tracking system would be very appreciated so that we know when they will arrive. 2) The rent keeps getting higher for things we do not demand for. So apparently there have been a spate of robberies in this apartment complex and the apartment complex made it mandatory for everyone to have alarm systems. Consequently, we are footing the bill to the tune of an extra $20 per month. In addition, they now required we have apartment insurance and that is us footing the bill as well. This doesn't count the fact that I have to pay an extra $30 per month to live on the third floor. And if you have pets, forget about it! That's about 300-400 (can't remember exactly) deposit. 3) Add a squat rack to your workout rooms. Also kettle bells would be nice too but they're not essential :)

The office staff are very kind and attentive. I am always impressed that they greet me by name - and I am not often in the office - and they always inquire as to how I am, etc. The maintenance staff is wonderful and work hard to get to any maintenance request usually the next day. The area is tidy and the trash valet is pretty awesome as they pick it up 5 days a week from your front door! I also appreciate having an alarm system within my apartment and a panic button next to my bed. (I have never had to use it, but it does provide peace of mind that it is available.) Having a police office liaison on the property is also an added benefit. The amenities are well kept and clean - the pool is clean and all the residents are so friendly when there. It is convenient to have the large grill and seating area for cookouts too! Having TWO workout rooms is wonderful too, as you can always get onto the machine that you want to use. I also recently rented the large theater room for a movie screening and the area has large comfy couches and chairs. We had a wonderful time there. The community is very close to shopping, restaurants, parks, and a movie theater. All can be reached in less than 5 minutes by car and you could even walk to a few if you wanted. In spite of the fact that the area is so close to the overpass, the noise is still quiet. The property is also around 10 minutes to Duke campus and the commute is very easy. I would recommend this property to people for the location, the property staff, the convenient amenities, and comfortable feel of the area.

Resident
2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/16/2014
I'm a current resident of Alden Place in a 1 BR on the second floor and have a very positive opinion thus far. Prices are reasonable for the location and apartments, and other than a few minor marks on the carpet, the apartment was in great condition when I arrived. The few issues that have arisen have been taken care of promptly. Office staff is always extremely kind and respectful, no problems there. There are 2 clubhouses, both with a pool and gym and both are kept up regularly. 2 minutes from Target and Harris Teeter, 5 minutes from Kroger and other shopping, 10 minutes from downtown Durham. A few improvements to be made: -As a pet owner, I will say that there are not nearly enough pet bag stations around the community (with some of them not regularly maintained) and the pet park is pretty small, but those things are minor, and the lack of pet rent is certainly a plus. -There are washer/dryer connections in the unit, but when installed, it's not possible to close the laundry room door. My washer and dryer are not oversized. This is probably more architectural and cannot easily be fixed, but it's something to think about if you're bringing your own W/D. -It's pretty easy to hear what's going on in the apartments above and below you. I've had no problems with those adjacent to me, but even laughing is easily heard. Overall, I'm having a fairly positive experience here and would recommend this apartment complex.

2012 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/05/2013
Where to start? I suppose I'll begin with what irritated me the most and drove me to write this review. "Management" here will try any number of questionable or shady tactics to hold you over to a new lease. Even if you don't want a new lease, they'll charge you for an extra month, at a rate ABOVE what you agreed to on your first lease. Management is also constantly doing pointless "renovations" that are really a way for them to justify a price increase and boost the profits of their corporate owners. Painting the outside of apartments feces brown or dull pink does not justify a $200/month increase in rent. It was also very noisy, with frequent parties going on on weekends. Maybe this was just where we lived, but it was still annoying, and it could be a crapshot based on where you end up. Also, you don't realize it when you first visit, but the part where we lived backs up onto the interstate. Expect to become very familiar with the sounds of the various emergency vehicles of Durham at all hours of the night. Another random point, but having clubhouses on BOTH sides of the street is POINTLESS, don't let them try to tell you its a plus. I'd rather have one decent sized gym and pool rather than two inferior ones that were only a few hundred feet apart. To top it all off, I know of people who had their apartments broken into because their windows didn't lock right. Hope you live on the third floor, lol! Ultimately, a bad place to live. Would have rated them as slightly below average were it not for the effort they go to to rip tenants off, but that really pushed me over the edge. Also, you won't be able to get the price we ended up getting ($1100/month)...its gone up since then. Pros: Parking is fine. You probably won't get robbed.

Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/03/2013
My lease is almost up and I have wanted to move since the day that it started. So I moved here hastily to start school after leaving active duty military service. When we first came to look at the unit my husband and I had a bad feeling, but school started in about a week, so we moved in with a short lease so that we could move in 9 months. Move in Condition When we can to view apartments there were several open which is always a bad sing especially in August when students are looking for housing. But like I said we were in a rush. The first apartment that was assigned to us was filthy. The carpets had stains and that blinds were broken. When we complained management said that it had "accidentally" not been cleaned. yeah right. So we requested a different unit. The new units had clean carpet but dirty everything else. The dishwasher had mold in it, the bathtub had a hole in the side wall, the garbage disposal was broken, all of the drains were clogged with hair, light-bulbs had not been replaced and there was blood and urine dripping down the front of the toilet. Yuck!!! Parking and Safety If you get home after 8pm forget about parking any where near your apartment. Also the light near the further parking area was broken for the first 6 months of the lease. When I asked management about this they said that it was Duke Energy's light and I should call them. About 3 months into the lease I started receiving notices about break-ins in the complex. There were 3 or 4 notices over the course of a couple months. There apartments advice "attend neighborhood watch meetings" and "be aware of surroundings" The People When we first came to view the apartment the people really did not seem interested in gaining new tenants. Every apartment that I had rented in the past was at least welcoming to prospective tenants, but not here. The woman showing the apartment had a bad attitude and staff that we met later were not much better. About 6 months in we received a notice stating that there would be new management. I thought that it would be an improvement but it went from bad to worst. This current staff is downright rude. They rarely speak and always seem bothered. Once they even lost a package and blamed it on the postman not delivering even after I showed them the notice slip from my mailbox. The Good The amenities are nice. However, the common areas like the movie room and study space are rarely clean and the trash bins are often overflowing. The pools are nice but given the general lack of cleanliness I would not swim in them. bottom line for the money, you can do so much better in Durham. I wish that I knew that 8 months ago!

2012 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/13/2013
Do NOT move here. If you value any of your belongings and would prefer not to leave a place with trust issues, run FAR away from this place. I left for a few weeks and came back to find some very valuable belongings of mine missing. It was obvious that someone with a key had been in my apartment while I was gone (toilet had been used, refrigerator open, and jewelry missing). I contacted the office about this and expressed how upset I was, and all they said was that no maintenance worker would have come in without my asking, and was not concerned at all about the situation - only told me to file a police report if I wanted to. Now, I know that I signed a lease and that they probably aren't responsible for losses, but it would be nice for them to show some concern that they might have some crooked people working for them and try to right a wrong. I have said a few things to them about this, including the fact that I no longer feel safe here and desperately feel like I need to move out, and unfortunately cannot break my lease. I loved this place before this happened, but now I want to run away as fast as I can and would not recommend a single person to live here. Please choose anywhere in Durham to live other than here. They don't care about you at all, they just want your money (and in some cases, your stuff). Also, one more thing - they will tell you that noise is not a problem and you can't hear your neighbors, but this is a flat out lie. I hear every single step that the person above me makes (and they are a small person), and I can even hear their phone vibrate. If you do live here despite the crooked and uncaring staff, make sure you get a top floor - it's worth the money (which is another totally complete scam...$50 extra a month to live on the top floor is ridiculous). 2012 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/06/2012
We lived here for the past 1 year and finally get to leave this horrible place. I should have known from the very beginning that I should have stayed away from this apartment complex. When we went to visit the place initially, the lady who showed us around seemed as if were greatly inconveniencing her. To make matters worse, when we went to pick up our keys and move in, we were given the wrong apartment. We informed the manager that we had initially agreed on a different apartment, but she basically blamed us for not having our facts straight. Unfortunately, we did not foresee this happening and we did not bring the necessary documents proving our case. Oh well. Life goes on... we thought. After living there for a few months, like others have already stated in their reviews, we, too, had problems with our celing leaking from the upstairs floor. The real kicker is that when our lease was coming up to an end, we had accidentally double paid for our last month's rent (our rent was automatically being deducted from our checking account, but due to some confusion, we also paid in person). When the mistake was realized, we asked to be refunded for the extra amount paid and were told that they'd settle it when we get our deposit back. We left that apt in a better condition than we moved in (e.g. there were mouse dropping when we moved in; when we moved out, we made sure the mouse droppings were cleaned up), but SURPRISINGLY, we got none of our deposit back. In fact, they charged us for random fees that resulted in us not even getting the extra money we paid during our last month there. When asked about that, we were told that the electricity to the ENTIRE building got disconnected (and they blamed us for doing it) and that Duke Energy charged them some ridiculous amount to get it reconnected. Interestingly, when we called Duke Energy about it, they said that they never did such a thing. Been e-mailing them regarding this for about the last 2 months... and they've yet to respond to my satisfaction. Outwardly, the place looks nice. However, taking into consideration the POOR management/leasing people, it really isn't worth the money. There are so many other nicer places around.

Resident
2008 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/16/2012
I have lived at Alexan for what is going to be 4 years this summer and have enjoyed my time here. I will address a few issues in some of the other reviews 1) Bugs - We have had virtually no bugs the entire time here. This may be because we have a 3rd floor apt away from the forested areas on the edge of the property but its been good otherwise. 2) Noise - Again maybe because of the top floor, but rarely hear anything out of the neighbors. 3) Safety - I have lived other places in Durham where I didn't feel safe but I definitely feel comfortable walking to my car late at night here. Lights are always on and parking is ample. I do know there have been several break ins over the time here but I know that because we always get a notice from the management that they are aware of the problem and informing us. Granted I wish it didn't happen but at least they tell us. 4) Management - Ok. I haven't interacted with them much besides renegotiating our lease each year so I don't have a lot on this one except they're nice when I get packages or go in to grab a coffee from the office. 5) Maintenance - This is one part I will definitely argue with. The maintenance staff is extremely nice and willing to help. Since the property is managed by some big parent company you have a 24 hour hotline that you call (in texas somewhere I think) and they take care of the order and I'm guessing have a set of things in the computer at the main office next day. Since the front office doesn't handle these calls directly maybe thats why a few complained they didn't know what to do with regards to maintenance. We have always had things fixed almost always the next day. Once our A/C compressor on our main unit outside broke and they were having a new one rushed 2 day over the weekend. This was in the spring and it wasn't boiling but still warm out and they brought up and setup a portable unit to keep us comfortable while they were getting a part in. Overall unless you are looking at crazy expensive places in Durham its one of the nicer places I've found. Also I will add the disclaimer I think the apartments on the North side of the complex are newer than the south side of the street, but the ones I've seen on both sides are pretty nice.
I have lived at Alexan for what is going to be 4 years this summer and have enjoyed my time here. I will address a few issues in some of the other reviews 1) Bugs - We have had virtually no bugs the entire time here. This may be because we have a 3rd floor apt away from the forested areas on the edge of the property but its been good otherwise. 2) Noise - Again maybe because of the top floor, but rarely hear anything out of the neighbors. 3) Safety - I have lived other places in Durham where I didn't feel safe but I definitely feel comfortable walking to my car late at night here. Lights are always on and parking is ample. I do know there have been several break ins over the time here but I know that because we always get a notice from the management that they are aware of the problem and informing us. Granted I wish it didn't happen but at least they tell us. 4) Management - Ok. I haven't interacted with them much besides renegotiating our lease each year so I don't have a lot on this one except they're nice when I get packages or go in to grab a coffee from the office. 5) Maintenance - This is one part I will definitely argue with. The maintenance staff is extremely nice and willing to help. Since the property is managed by some big parent company you have a 24 hour hotline that you call (in texas somewhere I think) and they take care of the order and I'm guessing have a set of things in the computer at the main office next day. Since the front office doesn't handle these calls directly maybe thats why a few complained they didn't know what to do with regards to maintenance. We have always had things fixed almost always the next day. Once our A/C compressor on our main unit outside broke and they were having a new one rushed 2 day over the weekend. This was in the spring and it wasn't boiling but still warm out and they brought up and setup a portable unit to keep us comfortable while they were getting a part in. Overall unless you are looking at crazy expensive places in Durham its one of the nicer places I've found. Also I will add the disclaimer I think the apartments on the North side of the complex are newer than the south side of the street, but the ones I've seen on both sides are pretty nice. Read less

2008 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/15/2010
The facilities here are nice enough, but the management and staff are awful. The management takes any opportunity to jack up the rent without properly notifying residents, and the staff is unbelievably rude. Unfortunately, living in an apartment complex means making frequent visits to the main office -- to pick up packages, renew leases, make maintenance requests, etc. I've been living at Alexan for almost 3 years and have come to completely dread those visits, because I know that every time it happens I'll be met with a rude comment or an exasperated sigh when I ask for something as simple as a new lightbulb. On a regular basis, I will ask for a package, be told it isn't there, call UPS and confirm that it was delivered -- then learn that the staff was just too lazy to actually look for it. This is one of the more expensive apartment complexes in Durham, and part of that premium should involve getting good service. But good service is absolutely NOT part of the deal at Alexan Place. If moving was a simpler process, I would have left a long time ago.

I lived at Alexan Place for a year and had a terrible experience. The grounds were always filthy, we had packages stolen from our door steps, parking was a nightmare, the car wash never worked, our apartment was entered without permission on three separate occasions. And of course the management is incredibly corrupt, downright evil. The tales of the leasing scams are all true. They will do everything in their power to convince you that you are getting the deal you think you are, but then they'll spring rate increases and fine print on you. Three months in advance of the end of our lease, we asked for a 1-month extension on our lease and were told it was no problem at all. They even told us (verbally so there's no proof) that our rates would continue for that month. Then, when the rent for that month was due, we got a notice saying that because we were out of our lease that the rent went up to $1300 . jep_castelein 05/11/2010

It's very interesting that the reviews of Alexan place are either very positive of negative (or should I say 'bashing management' reviews). Clearly, Al hasn't looked me up, because then he would have seen that I wrote a genuinely positive review (4/10/2010). We've just moved out of Alexan to move to back to California, but our experience with Alexan has been very good for the two years that we lived there. For people who consider Alexan: there is a market rate for all apartments, and a discounted rate. You get the discounted rate for a 6-12 month lease, or if you renew for a minimum of 3 months (at least, that was the case for us). There is a 2-month notice period. If you go month-to-month you pay the market rate plus $100 per month, but you have a 30-day notice period. We took advantage of that for the last 2 months we lived at Alexan. Our new place in California has an almost identical system, so I guess it's pretty common. I'm not sure about your deposit, but we never paid a deposit, maybe because we had a 'special'. The leasing options have been explained very clearly by the people in the leasing office. Maybe we had good luck, I'm not sure. If you're considering Alexan, I would recommend to ask questions until you fully understand the options for the lease, and don't sign anything without reading it. The place itself it pretty nice compared to other apartment complexes in Durham.

They don't want to help, they don't return phone calls, they usually don't have answers to questions (e.g. "I saw a note that the repairman was in my apartment-- what did he do there?" "Uhh I don't know." "Can you find out and let me know?" "Sure." And they never do). They apparently can't read-- I asked them to check the end date on my lease and they gave me the wrong date! I didn't have a copy of my lease because they don't give you one so they can save paper. And then when they give you incorrect information they charge you any penalties you incur based on that incorrect information. They are also rude (on the phone and in person). You won't get any southern hospitality from this place-- you're better off looking elsewhere.

Resident
2008 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/10/2010
After living at 2 other places in Durham, we are now living at Alexan Place for over 2 years. In our opinion this is one of the best places to live in Durham. It's safe, conveniently located, comfortable, dog-friendly and there is good management. Location & Safety - Alexan place is near everything: shopping, restaurants, Duke (8 minutes), close to the I-40 and not far from Chapel Hill. Durham definitely has some bad spots, but if you want to be close to Duke, this is the safest place you can be. There are many police officers living at the complex, and we've always felt safe. Just some examples of nearby shops: Harris Teeter, Kroger, Target, Sam's Club, Walmart, Home Depot, Lowe's, Office Depot, Staples, Best Buy, Bed Bath & Beyond, Petsmart, Petco and many more. The residents - Many Alexan Place residents have some connection to Duke, ranging from employees to PhD and grad students, doctors and nurses. These are mainly busy and quiet people, so it's not an undergrad party place. People also usually greet each other at the complex. The apartment - We live in a large 2-bedroom in the 600 block. The living room has a lot of natural light, with a sliding door towards the deck with a storage closet. It has a modern kitchen and pantry with space for a washer/dryer, 2 bedrooms with walk-in closets and 2 large bathrooms. They've given attention to detail: there are power, phone and cable sockets in every corner. I think they fix up all apartments before people move in: ours looked like new. The one minus is that the HVAC system is somewhat noisy. Dogs - We love the fully-enclosed dog park. I think this is the only complex in the Triangle with its own dog park. We have two small dogs and they love to go there to run and play with other dogs. At several places in the complex there are dispensers with poo bags, so you don't have to buy your own. When the weather is nice we use the car wash to wash the dogs. Alexan Place charges a non-refundable dog fee for each dog, but in our opinion that's worth it. Facilities - There are lots of facilities: two swimming pools, one of which is good for lapping (my wife taught me to swim properly there); two gyms that are usually not too crowded; free Starbucks coffee and popcorn in the office; a laundry with brand-new washers and dryers; a car wash; a playground; a business center with free Wifi; and optional daily garbage pick-up at your apartment. Management - The management is very professional, and the ladies in the office are always friendly and very helpful. Many of the staff have been there since we moved in, which is nice. They can also receive packages, which is very convenient. Maintenance - our previous landlord was pretty good: he always fixed things, but it could take a couple of days. At Alexan they fix things the same or the next day: wow! Even when our ceiling came down because of a leak it was fixed in a couple of days. The technicians are friendly and professional. Sometimes they even sing a capella in their lunch break, and they're pretty good at it :-) So all in all we're very happy to live here. We're city people, so Durham is a little too suburban for us. But if you want to live near Duke, this is a very nice place to be. PS. if you have questions, please leave a comment and I'll try to reply within a couple of days

Durham is a driving city. You won't get anywhere without a car. You may want to look at Station 9 or some of the apartments on Erwin Road (both walking distance to the Duke campus), but you may be better off buying a car and choose the apartment complex you like best.

2006 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/08/2009
I have lived at Alexan Place at South Square since it was built. The staff is extremely helpful and accommodating, and as a handicapped person they have bent over backwards to make sure that my apartment suited my needs. The maintenance staff is more-than-normally helpful, and attends to whatever needs come up very quickly. They recently began a garbage pick-up service which means no need to trek to the dumpster. They have beautiful grounds and pool areas. Lots of grad students, so occasionally in the summer the parking lot by the pool is pretty crowded with cars - mostly beginning and end of school and holidays. Otherwise there is lots of parking, plenty of handicapped parking. The police who live here keep the late noise level around the pool at an end at 11PM. They also keep their eyes on the property, which make me feel safe. Also they have allowed me to install an alarm system, since I live on the ground floor. All in all I would highly recommend this property. I have lived in several other complexes, and the friendliness and service here is outstanding.

Resident
2008 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/06/2009
My name is Bob Evanosky and I am the president and executive director of The Evanosky Foundation (www.evanoskyfoundation.org). The Evanosky Foundation supports pediatric leukodystrophy research, universal newborn screening, and assists children and families affected by a leukodystrophy, lysosomal storage disorders, or other disabling pediatric conditions. Since our conception in 2005, we have worked closely with the Duke Pediatric Bone Marrow Transplant program both in supporting the program in funding research and also helping care for families that have their son or daughter treated as a result of a terminal condition. As of last year, our foundation launched an initiative called the House of Hope program. The purpose of the program is to provide quality, suitable housing for children and their families that must remain near Duke for up to one year post transplant. We provide housing to the family at no charge to them personally. Even though we are a Chicago based 501(c)(3) corporation, we spent a tremendous amount of time here in Durham determining what apartment complex we would use to base our House of Hope program. Many factors were used in making the determination including but not limited to the overall aesthetics of the grounds, parking, interviewing both office and maintenance staff, willingness of the corporation that owns the complex to allow us to modify the interior to make it suitable for an immune compromised child (we needed to remove the carpet and replace with hardwood) and review of crime statistics in the area of the complexes being considered. In addition, my staff even went to a various apartments of the various complexes and interviewed residents about their experiences at the complexes we were considering. After compiling the data from the various fields, it was determined we would make Alexan Place at South Square the home for our House of Hope Program. The program has been in operation for a little over one year now and we are pleased with how all is proceeding. At present, we have 5 Houses of Hope at Alexan Place and we will add one additional per quarter. The completion of the program will be 15 units all at Alexan Place. One of the monthly duties my staff performs on behalf of the House of Hope program is to monitor the various grip sites that are suppose to help potential renters determine where they should rent. My foundation monitors these sites to aid us in staying informed about the happenings at Alexan Place. Coincidentally, I am a current resident here at Alexan Place since May of this year as a result of having two sons being transplanted presently at Duke; my third was transplanted at Duke in 2005. Since May, some of the Houses of Hope have had to have standard maintenance performed on them. I simply called the toll free maintenance number and a maintenance ticket was created and the work was performed within 24 hours as stipulated by the guarantee Riverstone provides all residents. Also, none of our families have ever complained of parking, but if one expects to park right outside their unit later in the day during the workweek, this may be a challenge. The farthest I have had to park from my unit is across the street. In addition, I have not seen any loose garbage on the property except for the garbage near the dumpster in the evenings after maintenance has gone home. The following day the garbage is gone and the dumpster area is clean. If, for whatever reason, I find that the wind has brought litter to my doorstep, I pick it up and dispose of it just like I do back at my home in Chicago. What I have observed recently regarding the pools is that a number of sororities and fraternities have hosted mixers most likely for the returning and new students coming to school; it brings back memories of my college years. I have observed children here at the complex but I would classify Alexan Place as more of a complex that serves the graduate student or young professional. Finally, I am personally aware of six law enforcement officers that live on the property; there may be more but I cannot validate that. As an individual reading this that may be in the market for an apartment I recommend that you do your own due diligence and investigate not only Alexan Place but the surrounding apartments; there are a few. Good luck

Resident
2007 - 2009 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/31/2009
When I first moved here, I loved it. I thought Alexan was beautiful and quiet and safe, but it turns out that I was wrong on pretty much all accounts. Some of the problems I have encountered while living here: - My apt is pretty much falling apart. Water leaks out of the walls constantly, and maintenance always claims to have fixed it, but they never do. Also, parts are falling off the dishwasher, the shower rod fell down, and the garbage disposal never works. - I'm a female living alone. Stupidly, management put me on the first floor. I've woken up to a strange man masturbating outside right outside my bedroom window. Management swore that they would step up security after that happened, but SURPRISE SURPRISE, they didn't do crap. -I got robbed while I was out of town. Even though my window was completely smashed in, and it was EXTREMEMLY OBVIOUS from the outside that something was wrong, nobody did anything. Maintenance guys walk past at least once a day, but apparently nobody found a smashed window at all suspicious. Once again, management pretended to feel bad for me and swore that this kind of thing never happens around here. Well, newsflash- it does. The people living directly across from me also got robbed the day after I discovered my robbery, but management "forgot" to tell anybody that. Management does their best to hide all the crimes that go on here. When I put up a security camera pointed at my front door (again, I'm a girl that lives alone who has had to call the police out to the apt twice. Starting to feel pretty unsafe), management informed me that I was giving people a "false sense of security" and I must take it down. -The noise levels are ridiculous. I can hear the guy that lives above me peeing in the morning. Ew. -Parking sucks in the evenings. -There's disgusting trash everywhere that nobody picks up. There was a rotting towel outside my door for at least a year. -Sure, there are two pools, but they're both tiny and full of screaming children (the children of the grad students that live here). I always go over to my friend's apt complex to swim because I hate the pools here. In other words, ALEXAN PLACE BLOWS. Spend your money elsewhere. PS: Management called me after posting this to yell at me. Delightful! PPS: Ignore the review above/below me referring to me as "sour grapes". Miss "TexasBlues" seems to spend an inordinate amount of time defending Alexan Place from all the haters on here, which I find to be rather suspicious. She's also freakishly enthusiastic about the maintenance team, which is just...weird. I'm a Duke Law student, I'm not insane, I have better grammar, and I never ever thought that I would have to resort to posting on a site like this. But, after everything that has happened, I felt that I had no other choice to make my opinion heard. So, judge if you like, but don't say I didn't warn you.

There is clearly a person (persons) on this board with a vendetta, holding a grudge and/or just they are just not used to apartment dwelling and getting along with other people. Alexan place is very quiet for a large apartment complex, mostly graduate students and young professionals, none of the partying that the naysayer writes about. anonymous 05/04/2009

I can't be the only one who thinks it's really strange that there's somebody who keeps posting positive reviews of this complex on the board who keeps writing "that's apartment living!" Does anybody know anybody who talks like that who isn't managing an apartment? The negative experiences are pretty easy to believe. Don't take my word for it, I'm not trying to sell you anything. When you visit, take a look at the lease they want you to sign. Is that the kind of legal document that welcomes you into a new community? There's a penalty if you die during your lease! Doesn't apartment management know what's happened every time someone's tried to enforce an early termination penalty due on the death of the tenant? That apartment complex shows up on TV. Journalists LOVE a story like that. Grieving parents, crying on TV, talking about how they got a nasty letter from management saying their poor son who just died owes them a couple of thousand dollars. And hey, it's legal, I'm not complaining. But if you're thinking of living here, take a hard look at that lease and ask yourself if you believe the people who keep posting about how everything is great if you do exactly as management says, and that all complaints are just part of apartment living. Or if you believe the people who say that management will squeeze you for every dollar they can. Just look at the lease they want you to sign.

2006 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/30/2009
I've been here for three years now and absolutely love it. I'm picky about living in a clean and well-maintained place, and Alexan has always met my needs. Specifically: -I've always been able to park right in front of my building, no matter the hours. -I can hear my neighbors running around upstairs a bit, but only a little. Or sometimes our neighbors to the side decide to blast their music, but honestly so do I and I figure it's a --- for tat and that's what you get for living in an apartment rather than a house. -The grounds are gorgeous, and if anything are too well maintained. My only complaint about this place is that they mow the lawn at least once a week and it always seems to start at 7:30am right outside my window. Since I'm still in school, 7:30am is not a time I ever plan on being awake. -I have always felt completely safe. I've even chatted with the nightly security guards as I walked the short distance from my car to my apartment. I've only had two packages left on my porch rather than delivered to the leasing office, but neither were stolen. -The construction is pretty good for the price you pay. No stainless steel appliances, but it is more than sufficient for my picky needs. The only thing we've ever really had problems with in the three years is the dishwasher is not exactly the best, but it does it's job. I love the layout and design of the place, and really loved that they let us paint a few walls to make it our own. -Maintenance has always been great. They have always responded within the same day, and once come at 11pm at night when we had a leak in the bathroom. The only complaint I have ever had about them is when some mold sprang up where the leak had been, they just painted over it rather than trying to treat it. -I've always found the staff to be very helpful. I haven't really had any outlandish requests, so I can't really say that I've seen them go above and beyond. But they have been great in helping me with mail, rent, and lease renewal. No complaints. Overall, this is just a great place to live. The location can't be beat. It's so close to the Harris Teeter/Target/some yummy restaurants. I also love that it is right in between Duke's campus and I40 and closer to Chapel Hill so it always made getting around easier. I'm only sorry that I have to graduate and leave.

Resident
2008 - 2009 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/02/2009
We first moved into Alexan in May of 2007, we were very pleased and impressed with the quality of the apartment and surroudning grounds, parking availability, and the maintenance. That impression lasted until the middle of August, when everything went to hell. I guess the complex was largely uninhabited in the summer, but once classes started everything went to hell. Parking became a nightmare - if you get back anytime after 10pm, expect to walk the equivalent of a city block to get to your apartment. The noise became unbearable. We were lead to believe that the residents were predominantly Duke graduate students, post docs and young professionals, but I've never known that demographic to party this much. The once beautiful grounds were completely trashed. Cigarette butts, animal droppings and garbage are often strewn across the complex. The complex looks safe enough, but looks can be deceiving. There have been a few break-ins since we lived here, but of course the management does its best to keep those under wraps. We only found out because we know the people who were robbed. We've also had a couple packages left at our door get stolen (couriers have since gotten wise and now deliver packages to the office). Maintenance is well meaning but poorly managed. Our apartment has, on two separate occasions, been entered by maintenance staff without our permission or notification. Both times were supposedly for a termite inspection. None of the amenities worked. The car wash was turned off for the first few months due to the drought, but once the drought was over a supposed "broken pipe" kept the car wash closed. To this day it still doesn't work. Worst of all, when we tried to move out, we asked management to give us an extra 2 weeks beyond the end of our lease. This request was made two months in advance. They told us it was completely fine and not to worry about it. When the end of the lease came around, management tried to charge us $676.45 for the extra 12 days we were going to stay. That amounts to almost $1800/month, an increase of over 100% of our original rent of $875. Management argued that this was allowed under the terms of our contract. I reviewed the contract and found nothing allowing management to raise the rent without providing 60 days notice. When I asked the property manager to clarify, she refused, and simply stated it was policy. Long story short, please don't be deceived by the appearance of this complex. While it looks nice enough, it is poorly run and unethically managed. Please don't repeat our mistake.

Resident
2005 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/24/2009
The one thing living at Alexan South Square has given me is the ability to see the future. See, I predict that the day after I post this review, probably around three completely positive reviews are going to mysteriously pop up from people who are REALLY ENTHUSIASTIC ABOUT LIVING HERE! Most likely one of them will be a 'business student'. I'm pretty sure they'll mention the fact that there are two pools, though. I'm not saying all the positive reviews which are written in the same style and show up on the same day and say nothing bad are fake, but honestly, has anybody ever met anybody who was enthusiastic about a monthly newsletter? You know who is enthusiastic about monthly newsletters? The person who's writing the monthly newsletter. Speaking of which, I haven't gotten one of those for a while, so if monthly newsletters really are a big draw for you, I have bad news. Here's the thing about Alexan South Square. There are, indeed, two pools. There is, yes, a dog walking area and a grilling area. Anything that can be touted in a brochure is technically there. It's the other little things that are missing. There is an utter lack of soundproofing. I've seen first day Habitat for Humanity volunteers do a better caulking job on a bathroom. Most of the shelves are made out of cheap particle board. The carpet is bargain basement. So is the kitchen flooring. I can hear it every time my neighbor takes a shower. When those business school students come home at three in the morning and want to shriek drunkenly? You'll know. Alexan South Square advertises itself as a luxury apartment complex, and if you think luxury is having 'stuff' like a grilling area and an exercise room, Alexan South Square has that. After living here for a while, though, I've realized that luxury isn't how many pools you have. Luxury is not being woken up every time somebody goes up the stairs in front of your apartment. Luxury is not being treated ungraciously by management if there is a problem. The ladies at the front office have always been helpful, polite, and kind. The grounds are well kept. The appliances are top of the line. It's just that there are other apartment complexes in the area which are much cheaper and just as noisy, and which don't have strange attitudes from upper management. Don't take my word for it. If you're interested in this apartment complex, visit an apartment, close the door and have your husband walk up the stairs. See if you can hear him from the bedroom. Have him talk outside the window. Look at the shelving. Then ask yourself what luxury means to you.

Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/28/2008
For one, Alexan Place is very convenient to Duke, NCCU, and even UNC Chapel Hill. Within two blocks you have Harris Teeter, Food Lion, Kmart, Super Target, Sams, McDonalds, Chickfila, Indian food, Thai food, Wendy's, etc... About a mile down you have a very large shopping center with more restaurants, pet stores, and much more. If you have children the school district is Forest View Elementary. From what I've heard, seen and read, it's a great school located in a beautiful, semi-rural area. The apartment itself is spacious, modern, and clean. The complex looks nice over all. I have dogs so I like the fact that it is a dog-friendly neighborhood with a dog park. The amenities like the business center, pool (with free wi-fi), gym, Starbucks coffee machine in the office, tanning bed, etc... are all nice. I like most of the people that live here, too. They are almost all very friendly and come from diverse backgrounds. When something needs repair in the apartment, the maintenance staff is courteous, prompt, and helpful. The walls are quite thick and my next door neighbor can't hear my kids or movies on my surround sound system. I'm not quite sure about the floors or ceiling, though. I can hear the upstairs neighbor walking but he's a quite guy and never has company or plays music. Those are the pros... For the cons... I would say the biggest drawback is the small percentage of people that move in and don't take care of their surroundings. Some have dogs and don't clean up after them even though there are stations with bags and a garbage can for clean-up. Others smoke and throw cigarette butts on the ground. Yet others just throw any trash on the ground. Luckily, this is a small percentage of the tenants. This brings me to my second complaint. I have one neighbor in particular that just moved in and throws cigarettes on the ground. I asked management to please ask her to stop littering. I was told they would put a notice on all the doors in the building. A week passed and nothing... I went back. The second time I had to speak to the manager. She got an attitude with me and told me the printer was broken and that they were going to do it. Another week passed and still no notice. I've pretty much just talked myself into dealing with it. If you ever have a complaint, I suggest speaking with one of the younger girls in the office. They are much more approachable. Let them deal with the sassy manager. Overall, I enjoy living here, though. The pros outweigh the cons. I would recommend it, especially to students. There are many young tenants here but it's quiet and safe overall.

2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/21/2008
To the poster who lost their job...Working in the medical field myself, I know the importance of license upkeep and ensuring that certifications never expire. So it makes me wonder how irresponsible you are that you didn't follow up, knowing the importance of your time-sensitive mail. So, short of the management staff willingly and deliberately taking your mail and refusing to give it to you, I find it hard to believe that your law case will stand a chance in court (but then again some lady is rich because she spilled McDonald's coffee on herself). It's amazing how ignorant and self-centered some of you people are. To anyone looking at Alexan... It is a wonderful place to live and the staff really does try their hardest to ensure you are satisfied. To address the few areas that I did not give 4-5 stars: overall the apartments are very quiet. I have yet to hear from my downstairs or next-door neighbors. My upstairs neighbors are naturally loud, like to run in the apartment and blast their music at odd hours. But short of sound proofing the whole complex, the noise reduction between units exceeds my expectations compared to some places I've lived. Maintenance is occasionally slow at getting around to things, but they are run by an outside company and if you simply emphasize the importance of your problem they will be there within the hour. My animals and I love this place and feel very safe. My dog enjoys the private dog park and the community is filled with friendly people. It is one of the few areas I looked at that didn't require a monthly addition to rent for pets, which was a huge plus. And the staff is really working hard to imporve this place daily. A new rec center and tanning room both just opened up that few residents have taken advantage of. I guess people should just read our monthly newsletter more often if they want to find out all the great stuff going on here.

My animals and I love this place and feel very safe. My dog enjoys the private dog park and the community is filled with friendly people. It is one of the few areas I looked at that didn't require a monthly addition to rent for pets, which was a huge plus. And the staff is really working hard to imporve this place daily. A new rec center and tanning room both just opened up that few residents have taken advantage of. I guess people should just read our monthly newsletter more often if they want to find out all the great stuff going on here. Read less

I am currently a resident at alexan place and I have had a plethora of problems with the complex since my husband and I moved in. The worst part came when the complex withheld my mail which had time sensitive information which caused my nursing lisence to lapse causing my employment to be suspended without pay!!! takeastand 03/21/2008

I am also a current resident of Alexan Place for over a year and have a hard time believing the above mentioned plethora of problems by these residents. They would have to be the exception rather than the rule. First off I have found tthe management and staff to be nothing but friendly, courteous, and responsive to my needs as a resident, and have seen the atmosphere in the office change even further for the better since the since the first of the year. They appear more outgoing and friendly and treat me as if my issue is the most important thing they have on their plate at the time. Any problem I have had with my apt.,no matter how major or minor, has been corrected in a very quick and courteous way. As for withodin mail, how can that be the responsibility of the office, mail is deliveredby the mail carrier to the mail station and if you have a regustered letter that has been left at the office the mail carrier will leave a notice on your door. It would appear to me that if I had a time-sensitive document that was direrctly related to whether I was employed or not I would have been looking for this letter daily and would have notified the office to keep their eyes out for it in case they left it at the office instead of looking for someone to blame for my own shortcomings. I have had packages and mail delivered to the office and always took it upon myself to stop by and check with the staff to get my packages as they have a huge room full of items and would be virtually impossible to know what was urgent or time-sensitive to me as a resident of over 500 units. As for the legal action I guess you can sue for anything but as a judge I would luv to hear how it could possibly be someone elses fault that you didn't pick up your own mail and where it was sombody elses responsibility to track you down to deliver it. As for the cars being broken into, hello, you live in a place that has a large parking area full of vehicles which is a target rich environment for would-be car thieves. The best way, just like with the mail, is to be responsible for your own actions, remove your valuables from sight, lock them in the trunk or take them inside with you. If you leave things out in the open you are inviting a car thief to take your stuff, don't park in a dark area or near bushes instead of looking for someone else to blame. What difference would it make to me if a few cars had been broken into and I was not notified, but I did get a letter, didn't you, but either way it is my responsibility to protect my belongings not the ladies in the leasing office. Sorry for the rant but I get tired of people who don't take responsibility for their own actions and are always looking for someone else to blame for anything that doesn't go their way. The office and maintenance staff have been nothing but kind, courteous, and professional to me in any interaction I have had with them and as long as I pay my rent n time I'm confident that relationship will continue. Their job is to provide me with living space for as long as I pay rent not to be my parents and make sure I have hid my valuables, locked my doors, or picked up my mail, that is my job as a responsible adult.

Resident
2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/21/2007
I had never been happy with an apartment complex I lived in before, but Alexan Place is, overall, a pretty good place to live in. I just graduated from Duke MBA (Fuqua), and my wife is a rising-third-year (3L) at UNC. We are moving out soon due to our relocation to Texas. Pros 1. Location is great. I have a seven-minute drive to my school, and my wife has a twelve-minute one to hers. 2. Facilites are high-quality. The gyms and the pools are nice. 3. There are a lot of graduate students in this complex. I know that there are at least thirty Duke MBAs (and their families) staying here. 4. Staff is very friendly. The packages not being found used to be a problem last year, but it seems that the packages are stored in a pretty organized manner now. 5. Maintenance crew is good. For example, our A/C was broken (leaking water), and the repair guys had to make four trips over a couple of days, but they fixed it well at the end. Cons 1. When I was trying to find an apartment in the area. I talked to a couple of apartment complex representatives (this is about two years ago). One of them told me that because of a lawsuit around year 2000, the new complexes do not have jacuzzis (hot tubs). So it is the same for Alexan Place -- no jacuzzi in which you can just drink your beer and relax. 2. Safety is not horrible, but is a concern for all complexes in Durham. This complex is in a nice area of Durham, but still -- stuff happens. My car was broken into last year; the thieves stole the stereo, so not a huge deal, I guess. Tip: Try to sign your lease as early as possible. We signed our lease before Duke's Blue ----- Weekend (in early April), and we ended up with a rate lower than what some of friends have had to pay.

Resident
2007 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/14/2007
I was a resident for several years, as were several other student friends of mine, and I decided to write in to share some of our collective experiences. First, as has been mentioned, there absolutely are issues with the management that took over the complex. Let me distinguish between management and maintenance, as the last poster is confused as to the difference. No one has a complaint with maintenance staff - they are around after hours and on weekends and are generally responsive and helpful. They, however, not management, installed the last poster's a/c units.<br><br>The problems with Alexan's management arise when you need more than maintenance's assistance. Read, for example, the caveat emptor or skip it posts. In addition to these issues, I personally dealt with management when I sought to extend my lease by a few months while I studied for the bar and was told that doing so would cost me nearly double rent per month. While I understand that the market and new management policies may well have required this, it is the way they treated me - a long time resident who had had no real problems in the past - that still resonates. There may be "two sides" to my story as well, but the fact remains that I was a paying customer, and management is in the customer service business. The woman I dealt with was rude, defensive, and unwilling to compromise. I ultimately moved out, and after all of that, my apartment was vacant over the summer! I was also charged, like an earlier poster, for my cheap carpeting despite living there for three years. They also continued to accept packages addressed to me, which I understand may have been unavoidable, but when I called to see whether they were there I was told that my packages are not their responsibility. I never found the packages, some important bar materials. <br><br>I don't recommend Alexan not because of their lease extension or package retention policies - it's the unforgiving nature of the staff when you hope for some humanity (how hard is it to search for my name on my bar materials?) that makes the place undesirable.<br><br>Also, I know this isn't as much a problem anymore, but I had a unit that was close to the construction and for a year was woken up by the early morning drilling - even on weekends. Now that they've got twice as many units to fill, management should stop being defensive and do a quick attitude check so they don't lose money on their investment.<br><br>PS, I don't know what last poster was looking at, but there are five recommendations for the complex below, a few completely anonymous and only one offering an email. Are they kidding when they say "all" positive posts are from those offering email addresses? I hope they're not graduating with a degree in math... my guess is management.

2002 - 2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/08/2007
I lived here for almost four years, and the place has definately gone downhill since the original office/maintenance staff left. They are very slow to respond or never respond at all. My carpet started coming apart at the seams and they never fixed it. And they charged me for new carpet when I left. I'm not sure what the average lifetime of bargain basement carpet is, but after living there for four years, I'm pretty sure they should have paid for new carpet themselves. I did have pets, but still. Also, the windows are very poor and caused me to have a large heating bill. Water leaked in around the seams and during the winter, it grew mold because the inside/outside temperature difference caused condensation. When I complained, I was told to keep the blinds up so the moisture didn't get trapped. Um... yeah. I think the blinds were the only thing keeping the cold out! I now pay less to heat my entire 1300 sq ft house.<br><br>Why did I stay? Because the office and maintenance staff that were they for the first three years made the difference. They were pleasant, responded quickly. The staff when I left last year were horrible! Also, the location is good, I never felt unsafe or had my car broken into. And I really miss the pool area! It is very nice and was always kept immaculate.<br><br>The large number of grad students who live there treat the place like a dorm. I can't count the number of times drunk students were making huge amounts of noise outside my bedroom window, in the breezeway, and in front of the buildings in the wee hours. But I guess if you like that kind of atmosphere, this one is a plus.<br><br>And the earlier poster who mentioned hearing people pee and dresser drawers closing? Yep. Same for me.<br><br>Overall, it's not bad for the money but know that you will probably have some issues.

All of the earlier posts regarding the thin walls, power outages, plumbing problems, construction disturbances, and car break-ins are on point and need not be repeated. I would not choose again to live at Alexan Place, but not only for those reasons. I believe the biggest problem with Alexan Place is its management. <br><br>Several posters have been here for only a few months. Read the posts of those who have been here for longer - long enough for something to go wrong. Sure, management is great when you're signing your lease or happily paying rent each month. But you really only need management when something goes wrong - and something inevitably will. That's when their true colors show. <br><br>One poster below described an encounter with a "saucy" manager. There are actually a few. If you have a problem and you take it to Alexan Place management, you'll be met with confrontation, not consolation. I've had a few apartment disasters while living here. No big deal, happens everywhere. What doesn't happen everywhere is getting attacked by management when you expect some courtesy or assistance. It's so jarring and unprofessional you'll find yourself more upset about the way you were just mistreated than about the original problem (perhaps that's their strategy?).<br><br>Unless you think you can make it through your lease without ever needing assistance from your rental property, skip this place. 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/09/2006
This apartment complex is really a mixed bag. It's kind of schitzophrenic, like someone said "I'm going to spec out a really nice apartment", then they gave it to some contractor who proceeded to see how many corners he could cut building it. <br><br>The apartments themselves are a mixture of good and bad. On the plus side, the layout is good. The apartment is spacious, with ample closet space. The appliances (dishwasher, fridge, stove, tub, etc.) are all high quality (except for the vent hood, which is weak). The patio's sliding door came with a security bar, which is a thoughtful touch. The clubhouse is excellent, and the fitness room is well equipped with a variety of machines and free-weights. The entire complex looks pretty, and is well maintained. The office staff is friendly, responsive, and has been very helpful. <br><br>The downside, however, becomes quickly obvious. The complex was simply poorly constructed. The walls are incredibly thin. I know way more about my neighbors than I ever wanted to. The guy upstairs? He wakes up at 6:30. Sometimes he wakes up early and forgets to turn off the alarm, and he thunders across the apartment to turn it off. Sometimes he wants to sleep in, and he hits the snooze alarm three times or so. I can hear all of that. I can hear every step he takes. Sometimes he pees really early in the morning. I worry that he may have some sort of infection or something, since he's much too young to be doing that.<br><br>There's a couple that lives up and to one side of me. They're a happy couple, and sometimes there's roughhousing. A lot of times there's high spirited yelling. I do know for sure that they keep their clothes in drawers, and that someone has a hard time deciding what they want to wear, because those drawers open and shut a LOT. They wake up at 6:00. I can hear all of that too. <br><br>Sometimes the guy who doesn't wake up until 6:30 gets angry at the couple who wakes up at 6:00, and there's angry yelling with a lot of naughty words. Then he starts playing music really loud.<br><br>Yeah, it seems like most of the people who live here are professionals ... but at least students sleep late. Let's be fair -- I'm sure that my neighbors don't enjoy listening to me when I have the urge to play bad 80's music, or when I'm ... being ... intimate. <br><br>Also, a lot of first floor apartments have air conditioning units located directly outside the bedroom. It's not so much that it's loud, but they kick in at 3:00 AM, and if you're a light sleeper ...<br><br>So yeah, thin walls. <br><br>There was an insect problem, but they sprayed, and it went away. Occasionally I wake up to find that an insect has tried to penetrate the Chemical Barrier and has promptly expired in the foyer-area. Now that is what I am talking about.<br><br>It seems like a pretty safe place -- I saw one window smashed out of a car to break in, though, so I'm not sure how safe it is. I just stopped parking near there. I don't keep expensive stuff in my car anyway. But if you do ... something to watch out for.<br><br>Oh, yeah, the carpet. I'm getting the little fuzzies every time I vacuum too. But I'm told that this is the carpet slowly thinning, and that it's evidence of cheap carpet. <br><br>So the summary is: It's still a pretty good deal. The apartment is very pretty. It's spacious for the price. It has its charms. But it's poorly made. If you have problems with noise, you might want to reconsider, or get a top floor apartment. And I wouldn't want to make long term plans for any of these apartments.

2004 - 2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/27/2006
We have lived here for over 2 years for 2 main reasons: its close to duke and we're too lazy to move. If we had it to do over again, we would DEFINITELY pick somewhere else and here's why:<br><br>1. When we first moved in it was filthy - like no one had cleaned since the last people moved out. Not just dust and mold, but unwanted hairs...you get the picture. It took weeks and multiple phone calls to have it cleaned (we happened to be on vacation right after we moved in), and they still did a bad job.<br>2. Also while we were on said vacation the vacant apartment upstairs flooded into our apartment. They tried to clean it up and not tell us. We confronted the maintenance guy when we discovered all our moving boxes were soaked and he confessed what happened but told us he wasn't supposed to tell us.<br>3. Our pipes are REALLY loud anytime anyone in the whole buidling uses the hot water. You don't just hear the water, but this knocking sound that is like dropping marbles on metal. Its wonderful when your neighbor wants to wash his face or a dish at 1am. Maintenance came several times to "fix" it before finally concluding that it was just poor construction materials and they'd have to install new pipes to fix it. They refused and told us to deal with it. <br>4. Walls and windows are paper thin. You can hear everything. I've lived in lots of apartments and this one's the worst.<br>5. The administration is the WORST and the staff changes more than I change my underwear. An example, our satellite company came to install our dish and per the satellite company's policy the rental office has to sign off on the installation before they will leave the property. The rental office signed and said no problem. Much later, under a new manager, we are told our satellite is in violation. When we explained to them it was approved, they said too bad, take it down, we don't have to honor old agreements. <br><br>I could go on and on and on...thank God we are graduating and moving soon!
