2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/08/2006
Generally speaking, this is a nice area to live. Especially with some promotion price at the new apartment areas, which was completed at Nov, 2005. It is really new, the fitness center is really new, the pool is nice, also, the open bbq area with big TV and sofa is really great. I would recommend others to live in this area, but still I did not give a high rating because...<br><br>It is usually very quite, although one side of the community is facing 15-501, but if you close your windows, you won't hear much. Also, you won't hear your neighbours much. But, if you live by the pool, be aware that there might be neighbours, who will swiming and chasing around the pool during the midnight, I mean 1:00am-3:00am. If your bedroom happen to be facing the pool, you will hear some noise... Also, sometimes at night, you can still hear people chatting/playing at the bbq area(which is by the pool), and they may turn the pool speakers on, which add some more noise. It is nice to have people around and using the pool and bbq areas, but jut NOT MIDNIGHT.<br><br>Secondly, the leasing office might response you VERY slowly. For example, we requested to ask the mentaince guy to help us install some extra lights, but it took us 4 visits to the leasing office to get it done. Another example is that our alarm system was broken during some thunderstorm while we are away(for a trip). After we came back, we found out that one of the bedroom do not have electricity. If we turn it on, the alarms will be on(with loud sounds). So we went to the leasing office, and request a repair. We visited them almost everyday, until everyone in the office knows our apartment... Finally, after more than 2 weeks without electricity in our bedroom, they fixed it. It took 2 WEEKS!<br><br>One more thing, this is a new aparment, and you expect everything is new. Ovens, furniturs, carpet... which is good. But I am not sure whether is the problem with the pool quality carpet in this community, or is the problem with all new carpet, our floor will "grow" some fuzzy white things after a while(say 3 or 4 days) and you need to use vaccum or pick them up frequently. We complained this, but they say it is a typical problem with all new carpet, and the only solution is to use the vaccume more frequently. And we've been using our vaccume frequently for about 2 months, still the fuzzy thing continues "growing".<br><br>Other than these, we don't have much complaint. One minor issue is the parking place is quite narrow. But since there isn't much people here now(because it is really new), they is a lot empty parking place, and if you just park one location away from other cars, the space is "a lot". Anyway, minor issue, you just need to be more careful while parking. About safty issue, I read some negative reviews before I moved in. But so far, I think it is OK, since I did not experiance nor heard about car window break ins.<br><br>To summarize, it is a nice community with some problems. I love this place, if they can make the service better, and if there is no big noises from the pool area after 24:00.

I have lived in the apartment since May 2003 and am quite satisfied. I have lived in many apartments over the years and these are among the best. Certainly, there are times when noise from the neighbors is present; however, I have never lived in either a house nor apartment where this is not an issue. Here it is relatively quiet and my experience is that the office staff are very helpful and have expeditiously treated any concerns I might have had. I have had no problems whatsoever in getting minor repairs done in a timely fashion. They have even delivered mail left in the office to my apartment when I called and said I would not make it there before the office has closed. I would highly recommend this as a place to reside and have renewed my lease twice and plan to do so once more.

Resident
2004 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/30/2005
Last Fall I moved to Durham after taking a new job at Duke University. I decided to rent for a year till I figured out the best area in which to buy a home. Since I already had friends here, I checked in with them and got some recommendations on places to stay, since obviously there are "good" areas of Durham, and then "not so great" areas in Durham. I decided that I didn't want to go with a loft-style apartment like they have downtown, so I looked at three places off 15/501 and Alexan Place got my vote. It's convenient to both 15/501 and I-40, the amenities are great, the apartments are larger than what I expected. The staff was great when I first moved in, and they haven't changed since I've been there...they've been helpful, and I haven't had any problems. So what if they're building another apartment community right next door? Coming from a larger city...you realize that some people can make a big deal out of the smallest things, and some people will never be happy with what they have. I like it at Alexan Place, and if asked, I would recommend it over any other community in the area.

2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/29/2003
Alexan Place is an excellent apt. complex. The apartments are new (built in 2002), spacious (2 bdrm over 1100 sq. ft. w/9 ft. ceilings), and conveniently located (close to grocery stores, shopping malls, downtown Durham, and soon a Super Target). Others spoke of break-ins here. I moved here from a ghetto apartment in Carrboro, and can safely say that Alexan Place is very safe and very well-lit in comparison. The office staff is very friendly a well. Rent isn´t so bad - $850/mo. for a 2 bedroom after factoring in the first 2 months free. The only complaint I have is that the parking spaces are narrow. I have gotten a few scratches and dents on my car from others´ car doors. I highly recommend Alexan Place.

(I worried at first that they were too small, but they have great closets, a nice pantry, etc...) It is the perfect size for us. <br> <br>The maintenance people are wonderful!!! One Friday evening recently I was out on the balcony. Somehow the security pin slipped into place... anyway, the door wouldn´t open. I was stuck out on the balcony! One of the other tenants (everyone I´ve met here is SO nice, by the way), phoned maintenance. They were there almost immediately to help me. <br> <br>They are really quiet. I do hear the people above me when they walk across their kitchen, but that is it. I´ve never heard kids, dogs, talking, music... <br> <br>They are conveniently located to shopping, Duke U., Chapel Hill,... <br> <br>We absolutely love it here!!
